page.title: 10A Day at Newton Toney
page.content: While we walked down the road we saw an old cottage that looked as though nobody lived in it . Then we passed the local which is called the {Mallet {Arms.}It is named after some rich people in Newton Toney. When we got to {Newton Toney school}we met the headmaster and churchwarden. We interviewed the children at the school,then we looked around the village. It has one {Post Office }and Stores which is just opposite the bridge over the {River Bourne.}There is a church in Newton Toney dedicated to {St.Andrew.}In Newton Toney most of the houses are cottages in the main part of Newton Toney.The railway runs to the north east of Newton Toney.There are about 30 people in Newton Toney School.
